children.subject: Weren't you guys given a list of other courses that fulfilled the requirement? If an EECS major can't take it, they're screwed because a bunch of their other courses depend on it. Ditto for MechE and probably BioE.

+1 for the LSCS supporter. It's understandable that COE people need it for other classes but especially considering the new option to take 16a/16b instead of 16a/54, LSCS should at least be given equal preference for it.
Also 16a is a requirement for LSCS

And for a bunch of the engineering majors. But L&S CS students have the option to take something else (at least juniors and seniors do), and can take Math 54 instead of 16B. Meanwhile, many non-EECS engineers who can't take it literally cannot take other required classes or fulfill their desired concentrations. MechE's have (at least) 102AB, so at the minimum they have to take 16A as juniors, or they cannot graduate. And that's if they aren't concentrating in controls or MEMS or something. BioE's doing any sort of medical device stuff have to take 16A, and likely 16B before they can do half their upper divs. Ditto for energy engineers or engineering physics majors who want to do power systems.

Even if they don't/can't take an alternative to 16A, CS majors only need to take it their very last semester in order to graduate (and I remember the CS department helping seniors with that last year). I haven't met a CS major yet who has wanted to go into the EE side of things, and while they probably exist, most CS majors don't actually need 16a until their last semester. Maybe they could do a petition system where CS/BioE/EnergyE majors who wanted to do EE-related upper divs would get priority, but otherwise, giving CS majors priority would be akin to shoving out most of the engineers who actually need it (seeing as the CS major is twice the size of all non-EECS engineering majors that would need 16A combined...)

Rather than setting up a petition system for specific majors, I think everyone who needs it for their major should get equal preference and a petition system should be set up specifically for any person of those majors to get special access to the course through CCNs for the purpose of taking future courses. This process could be advisor-facilitated. I think this may be more efficient because there are a lot of EECS majors who take the CS route and don't necessarily need it early on either, so it doesn't make sense to blindly put all of EECS before CS. Similar arguments can be made for all the other majors listed.
How does it make sense that LSCS declared don't get priority on the waitlist?

It's difficult to read the enrollment in CalCentral because we issued 245 permission numbers which do not show when they're used, unlike the other categories. Since it's a new system, we didn't know that would make the enrollment harder to understand.

Sorry if I missed your email! I thought I replied to everyone, but I clearly didn't see yours. Please feel free to follow up with me at lraya@eecs.berkeley.edu.

Does that mean there are 245 more people enrolled in the class than shown on schedule builder? Or are those 245 people included in the enrollment total. Since the class currently says there are 134 open seats on calcentral, will those ever be opened up?
I believe that is saying that 134 of the 245 seats are open. Please see my response about those remaining seats in @1801.

I'm confused because in the enrollment in calcentral it says

0 of 245 reserved seats filled for requirement: Enrollment by Permission Only

How are there no permission numbers if 245 seats are empty? I'm an incoming EECS transfer, do I qualify for this? I sent an e-mail a couple days ago and have received no response regarding this...

Does that mean there are 245 more people enrolled in the class than shown on schedule builder? Or are those 245 people included in the enrollment total. Since the class currently says there are 134 open seats on calcentral to get to the total of 600, will those seats ever be opened up?

history.content:
If you have questions about EE16A enrollment including permission numbers, unfortunately we don't have any updates for you at this time and there are no more permission numbers. We expect to have more information about how many open seats there will be in about a week. We will update you as soon as we have more information.

We understand this is a frustrating situation, especially with the roll-out of the new system and all the new obstacles that have manifested. 

Thank you in advance for your continued patience!
history.subject: EE16A Enrollment Update
